org.aludratest
Class AludraTest

java.lang.Object
  org.aludratest.AludraTest

public final class AludraTest
extends Object

AludraTest framework class. This is the main entry point to AludraTest. Clients can either invoke the class via its main method directly, or construct an instance of this class and call one of its run methods.

Author:
Volker Bergmann, falbrech

ENVIRONMENT_NAME_PROPERTY

public static final String ENVIRONMENT_NAME_PROPERTY
The name of the System Property which is checked for the environment name to use.

Constant Field Values
Method Detail

startFramework

public static AludraTest startFramework()
Starts the AludraTest framework

Returns:
the freshly created instance

stopFramework

public void stopFramework()
Stops the AludraTest framework

getInstance

@Deprecated
public static AludraTest getInstance()
Deprecated. This method should not be used for software design reasons. Better keep your AludraTest instance which is returned by startFramework, or use IoC patterns to retrieve components you need.

Returns the current AludraTest instance. This method will only return a non-null value between calls to startFramework() and stopFramework().

Returns:
The current AludraTest instance, or null.

getEnvironmentName

public static String getEnvironmentName()
Returns the name of the current environment. This is a central parameter of AludraTest and used to distinguish configuration for different environments. Pass it e.g. via command line System Property: 
 -DaludraTest.environment=MYHOST

Returns:
The name of the current environment. Defaults to LOCAL if none has been set.

getServiceManager

public AludraServiceManager getServiceManager()
Returns the service manager of AludraTest. This can be used for service and component lookups. If you have a context available (an AludraTestContext or an AludraServiceContext), you should prefer to call its methods for these lookups.

Returns:
The service manager of AludraTest, never null.

run

public int run(File jarOrClassRoot,
               String filterString,
               String categoryString,
               ClassLoader classLoader)
        throws ParseException
Executes tests based on their TestAttribute annotations. Waits until all tests are finished.

Parameters:
jarOrClassRoot - A JAR file or a folder containing all class files to search.
filterString - A filter for test classes to include in the execution. See AludraTest Documentation for syntax.
categoryString - A comma-separated string identifying the order of attributes to use for top-level, second-level etc. grouping.
classLoader - The class loader to use to load the test classes, or null to use the default class loader.
Returns:
The resulting exit code.
Throws:
ParseException - If the filter or category string is invalid.
Since:
AludraTest 3.0.0

run

public int run(Class<?> testClass)
Parses the test class/suite, executes it and waits until all tests are finished.

Parameters:
testClass - The AludraTest class or test suite to run
Returns:
the resulting exit code

runWithCmdLineArgs

public static int runWithCmdLineArgs(String[] args)
implements the functionality of the class' main method without calling System.exit(int), but providing the respective exit code as method return value.

Parameters:
args - the command line arguments
Returns:
the exit code resulting from command evaluation, class parsing and test execution

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws ClassNotFoundException
Main method for running Aludra tests.

Parameters:
args - expects a class name as single argument
Throws:
ClassNotFoundException - if the class of the provided name was not found
